alert.note: Alert for Coahoma; Quitman (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 4:58PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Coahoma and western Quitman Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 458 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Darling, or 16 miles northeast of Clarksdale, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jonestown, Belen, Darling, Coahoma, West Marks, Rudyard, Barksdale, Hinchcliff, Sabino, Roseacres, Matagorda, Rich and Essex. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
